<div class='row t1 b1'>
  <div class='medium-4 columns'><b>Name:</b></div>
  <div class='medium-8 columns'><code class="highlighter-rouge">anova</code></div>
</div>
<div class='row t1 b1'>
  <div class='medium-4 columns'><b>Type:</b></div>
  <div class='medium-8 columns'><a href="{{ site.url }}/tag/mchoice/"><code class="highlighter-rouge">mchoice</code></a></div>
</div>


<div class='row t20 b1'>
  <div class='medium-4 columns'><b>Preview:</b></div>
  <div class='medium-8 columns'><div class="webex-group">
<div class="webex-question">
<div class="webex-check webex-box">
<p>A survey with 51 persons was conducted to analyze the design of an advertising campaign. Each respondent was asked to evaluate the overall impression of the advertisement on an eleven-point scale from 0 (bad) to 10 (good). The evaluations are summarized separately with respect to type of occupation of the respondents in the following figure.</p>
<p><img src="data:image/png;base64," /></p>
<p>To analyze the influence of occupation on the evaluation of the advertisement an analysis of variance was performed:</p>
<pre><code>  Res.Df    RSS Df Sum of Sq     F     Pr(&gt;F)
1     50 53.549                              
2     47 34.018  3    19.531 8.995 8.1265e-05</code></pre>
<p>Which of the following statements are correct?</p>
<div id="webex-0391f9f9f0853a71700fa5f74d1ebde4" class="webex-checkboxgroup" data-answer="awIVAUoJSghKAWU=">
<label><input type='checkbox' autocomplete='off' name='0391f9f9f0853a71700fa5f74d1ebde4'/><span>It can be shown that the evaluation of the respondents depends on their occupation. (Significance level <span class="math inline">\(5\)</span>%)</span></label><label><input type='checkbox' autocomplete='off' name='0391f9f9f0853a71700fa5f74d1ebde4'/><span>The fraction of explained variance is larger than <span class="math inline">\(60\)</span>%.</span></label><label><input type='checkbox' autocomplete='off' name='0391f9f9f0853a71700fa5f74d1ebde4'/><span>A one-sided alternative was tested for the mean values.</span></label><label><input type='checkbox' autocomplete='off' name='0391f9f9f0853a71700fa5f74d1ebde4'/><span>The fraction of explained variance is smaller than <span class="math inline">\(45\)</span>%.</span></label><label><input type='checkbox' autocomplete='off' name='0391f9f9f0853a71700fa5f74d1ebde4'/><span>The test statistic is larger than <span class="math inline">\(7.5\)</span>.</span></label>
</div>
</div>
<div class="webex-solution">
<p>In order to be able to answer the questions the fraction of explained variance has to be determined. The residual sum of squares when using only a single overall mean value (<span class="math inline">\(\mathit{RSS}_0\)</span>) as well as the residual sum of squares when allowing different mean values given occupation (<span class="math inline">\(\mathit{RSS}_1\)</span>) are required. Both are given in the RSS column of the ANOVA table. The fraction of explained variance is given by <span class="math inline">\(1 - \mathit{RSS}_1/\mathit{RSS}_0 = 1 - 34.018/53.549 =
0.365\)</span>.</p>
<p>The statements above can now be evaluated as right or wrong.</p>
<ul>
<li>True. The <span class="math inline">\(p\)</span> value is <span class="math inline">\(8.13e-05\)</span> and hence significant. It can be shown that the evaluations differ with respect to the occupation of the respondents.</li>
<li>False. The fraction of explained variance is <span class="math inline">\(0.365\)</span> and hence <em>not</em> larger than 0.6.</li>
<li>False. An ANOVA always tests the null hypothesis, that all mean values are equal against the alternative hypothesis that they are different.</li>
<li>True. The fraction of explained variance is <span class="math inline">\(0.365\)</span> and hence smaller than 0.45.</li>
<li>True. The test statistic is <span class="math inline">\(F = 8.995\)</span> and hence larger than <span class="math inline">\(7.5\)</span>.</li>
</ul>
</div>
</div>
<div class="webex-question">
<div class="webex-check webex-box">
<p>A survey with 48 persons was conducted to analyze the design of an advertising campaign. Each respondent was asked to evaluate the overall impression of the advertisement on an eleven-point scale from 0 (bad) to 10 (good). The evaluations are summarized separately with respect to type of occupation of the respondents in the following figure.</p>
<p><img src="data:image/png;base64," /></p>
<p>To analyze the influence of occupation on the evaluation of the advertisement an analysis of variance was performed:</p>
<pre><code>  Res.Df    RSS Df Sum of Sq      F   Pr(&gt;F)
1     47 53.615                             
2     44 27.809  3    25.806 13.611 2.04e-06</code></pre>
<p>Which of the following statements are correct?</p>
<div id="webex-4cf2f82c04a656ed8b214e4558a15edf" class="webex-checkboxgroup" data-answer="b1JKA0oIHlMcBTw=">
<label><input type='checkbox' autocomplete='off' name='4cf2f82c04a656ed8b214e4558a15edf'/><span>It can be shown that the evaluation of the respondents depends on their occupation. (Significance level <span class="math inline">\(5\)</span>%)</span></label><label><input type='checkbox' autocomplete='off' name='4cf2f82c04a656ed8b214e4558a15edf'/><span>The fraction of explained variance is larger than <span class="math inline">\(19\)</span>%.</span></label><label><input type='checkbox' autocomplete='off' name='4cf2f82c04a656ed8b214e4558a15edf'/><span>The test statistic is larger than <span class="math inline">\(23.1\)</span>.</span></label><label><input type='checkbox' autocomplete='off' name='4cf2f82c04a656ed8b214e4558a15edf'/><span>A one-sided alternative was tested for the mean values.</span></label><label><input type='checkbox' autocomplete='off' name='4cf2f82c04a656ed8b214e4558a15edf'/><span>The fraction of explained variance is smaller than <span class="math inline">\(51\)</span>%.</span></label>
</div>
</div>
<div class="webex-solution">
<p>In order to be able to answer the questions the fraction of explained variance has to be determined. The residual sum of squares when using only a single overall mean value (<span class="math inline">\(\mathit{RSS}_0\)</span>) as well as the residual sum of squares when allowing different mean values given occupation (<span class="math inline">\(\mathit{RSS}_1\)</span>) are required. Both are given in the RSS column of the ANOVA table. The fraction of explained variance is given by <span class="math inline">\(1 - \mathit{RSS}_1/\mathit{RSS}_0 = 1 - 27.809/53.615 =
0.481\)</span>.</p>
<p>The statements above can now be evaluated as right or wrong.</p>
<ul>
<li>True. The <span class="math inline">\(p\)</span> value is <span class="math inline">\(2.04e-06\)</span> and hence significant. It can be shown that the evaluations differ with respect to the occupation of the respondents.</li>
<li>True. The fraction of explained variance is <span class="math inline">\(0.481\)</span> and hence larger than 0.19.</li>
<li>False. The test statistic is <span class="math inline">\(F = 13.611\)</span> and hence <em>not</em> larger than <span class="math inline">\(23.1\)</span>.</li>
<li>False. An ANOVA always tests the null hypothesis, that all mean values are equal against the alternative hypothesis that they are different.</li>
<li>True. The fraction of explained variance is <span class="math inline">\(0.481\)</span> and hence smaller than 0.51.</li>
</ul>
</div>
</div>
<div class="webex-question">
<div class="webex-check webex-box">
<p>A survey with 53 persons was conducted to analyze the design of an advertising campaign. Each respondent was asked to evaluate the overall impression of the advertisement on an eleven-point scale from 0 (bad) to 10 (good). The evaluations are summarized separately with respect to type of occupation of the respondents in the following figure.</p>
<p><img src="data:image/png;base64," /></p>
<p>To analyze the influence of occupation on the evaluation of the advertisement an analysis of variance was performed:</p>
<pre><code>  Res.Df    RSS Df Sum of Sq     F  Pr(&gt;F)
1     52 33.596                           
2     49 32.416  3     1.180 0.594 0.62163</code></pre>
<p>Which of the following statements are correct?</p>
<div id="webex-c5398655759c3fc2b695d138559bb091" class="webex-checkboxgroup" data-answer="OAUfCRQHGQUbBWQ=">
<label><input type='checkbox' autocomplete='off' name='c5398655759c3fc2b695d138559bb091'/><span>A one-sided alternative was tested for the mean values.</span></label><label><input type='checkbox' autocomplete='off' name='c5398655759c3fc2b695d138559bb091'/><span>It can be shown that the evaluation of the respondents depends on their occupation. (Significance level <span class="math inline">\(5\)</span>%)</span></label><label><input type='checkbox' autocomplete='off' name='c5398655759c3fc2b695d138559bb091'/><span>The fraction of explained variance is smaller than <span class="math inline">\(12\)</span>%.</span></label><label><input type='checkbox' autocomplete='off' name='c5398655759c3fc2b695d138559bb091'/><span>The test statistic is larger than <span class="math inline">\(3.2\)</span>.</span></label><label><input type='checkbox' autocomplete='off' name='c5398655759c3fc2b695d138559bb091'/><span>The fraction of explained variance is larger than <span class="math inline">\(13\)</span>%.</span></label>
</div>
</div>
<div class="webex-solution">
<p>In order to be able to answer the questions the fraction of explained variance has to be determined. The residual sum of squares when using only a single overall mean value (<span class="math inline">\(\mathit{RSS}_0\)</span>) as well as the residual sum of squares when allowing different mean values given occupation (<span class="math inline">\(\mathit{RSS}_1\)</span>) are required. Both are given in the RSS column of the ANOVA table. The fraction of explained variance is given by <span class="math inline">\(1 - \mathit{RSS}_1/\mathit{RSS}_0 = 1 - 32.416/33.596 =
0.035\)</span>.</p>
<p>The statements above can now be evaluated as right or wrong.</p>
<ul>
<li>False. An ANOVA always tests the null hypothesis, that all mean values are equal against the alternative hypothesis that they are different.</li>
<li>False. The <span class="math inline">\(p\)</span> value is <span class="math inline">\(0.622\)</span> and hence_not_ significant. It can <em>not</em> be shown that the evaluations differ with respect to the occupation of the respondents.</li>
<li>True. The fraction of explained variance is <span class="math inline">\(0.035\)</span> and hence smaller than 0.12.</li>
<li>False. The test statistic is <span class="math inline">\(F = 0.594\)</span> and hence <em>not</em> larger than <span class="math inline">\(3.2\)</span>.</li>
<li>False. The fraction of explained variance is <span class="math inline">\(0.035\)</span> and hence <em>not</em> larger than 0.13.</li>
</ul>
</div>
</div>
</div></div>
</div>

<div class='row t20 b1'>
  <div class='medium-4 columns'><b>Description:</b></div>
  <div class='medium-8 columns'>Compute different pieces of information (F-statistic, R-squared, significance, etc.) from an ANOVA table (and accompanying parallel boxplots). In each choice item, some quantity should be computed 'by hand' and compared against some given value (which may be true or false).</div>
</div>
<div class='row t1 b1'>
  <div class='medium-4 columns'><b>Solution feedback:</b></div>
  <div class='medium-8 columns'>Yes</div>
</div>
<div class='row t1 b1'>
  <div class='medium-4 columns'><b>Randomization:</b></div>
  <div class='medium-8 columns'>Random numbers, text blocks, and graphics</div>
</div>
<div class='row t1 b1'>
  <div class='medium-4 columns'><b>Mathematical notation:</b></div>
  <div class='medium-8 columns'>Yes</div>
</div>
<div class='row t1 b1'>
  <div class='medium-4 columns'><b>Verbatim R input/output:</b></div>
  <div class='medium-8 columns'>Yes</div>
</div>
<div class='row t1 b1'>
  <div class='medium-4 columns'><b>Images:</b></div>
  <div class='medium-8 columns'>Yes</div>
</div>

  <div class='medium-8 columns'>No</div>

_(Note that the HTML output contains mathematical equations in MathML, rendered by MathJax using 'mathjax = TRUE'. Instead it is also possible to use 'converter = "pandoc-mathjax"' so that LaTeX equations are rendered by MathJax directly.)_

**Demo code:**

<pre><code class="prettyprint ">library(&quot;exams&quot;)

set.seed(403)
exams2html(&quot;anova.Rmd&quot;, mathjax = TRUE)
set.seed(403)
exams2pdf(&quot;anova.Rmd&quot;)

set.seed(403)
exams2html(&quot;anova.Rnw&quot;, mathjax = TRUE)
set.seed(403)
exams2pdf(&quot;anova.Rnw&quot;)</code></pre>
